chunks.text: In this tutorial, we'll wrap up all the classes we've made till now and a big part of the code in the main function into a mesh class

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: that will also serve as a stepping stone for importing models in a future tutorial.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: First, a rough definition of a mesh. A mesh is a dataset that almost always contains vertices, often contains indices, and sometimes contains textures as well.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: And they are generally used to create 3D models.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So, let's create a header file for the class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: First, we'll want to include a string library, and then the VIO, IBO, camera, and texture classes, since we wanted three of our classes dependencies to look like this.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now for the class itself, all the clear three vectors named vertices, indices, and textures.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Note that these are C++ vectors and not GLM vectors.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: We are using vectors instead of arrays, since we can't know the size of our arrays, so it's best to keep things flexible in terms of storage.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: As you can see, we get some errors, but don't worry, we'll fix those after we finish writing everything in here.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Next, we also want to store our VIO, since we'll be initializing it using this class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then, for the constructor, we'll simply input the vertices, indices, and textures, and lastly, we'll make a function draw that will take in a shader,

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: and a camera.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now for the errors, let's go to the VIO class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: If you've been paying attention, you probably would have noticed that our vertices vector contains a structure named vertex.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: But we don't have one so far, so let's create one right here.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: I'll simply name the structure vertex, and give it three vectories for the position normal in color, and then a vector for the texture coordinates.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Having our data packed in such a structure is nicer than simply having all the data in one array, at least in my opinion.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Don't forget to also include the GLM library, though.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now we need to patch up the VIO class constructor to accept the vector of vertex structs instead of an array.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So let's also include the C++ vector, and since we're using vectors instead of arrays, we can now also get rid of the size input,

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: since we can calculate that inside the class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So in the VIO dot CPP file, we can replace the size by vertices dot size times size of vertex, and for the data, we just write vertices dot dot.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: If you return to the mesh class, you should have no more errors.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now let's do what we did for the VIO class to the EBO class as well, replacing the array with a vector.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now for the main part, let's create the mesh dot CPP file, insert writing the functions for this class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Let's start with a constructor, by simply assigning the inputs to the variables of the class, then copy paste initialization of the VIO from the main function,

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: and modify the variables names slightly, and also the way the attributes are stored.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: We want the position first, then the normals, then the colors, and finally the texture coordinates.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Since we've modified this, we should go to the vertex shader and rearrange the new order of the vertices sections properly, and then do the same thing in the fragment shader as well.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: It's not mandatory to keep them in this specific order when importing or exporting them, but it just looks nicer to have them in the same order everywhere.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Though it is important to have them in the proper order when choosing the layouts in the vertex shader.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now let's continue with our mesh class by writing the drop function.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: We'll start by activating the shader, and biting the VIO as usual.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now we'll have to do something a bit more complicated in order to properly load the textures, since we won't always know how many textures a mesh has.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So let's create two unsigned integers that are equal to zero, and are named numdefuse and numspatular.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: These will keep common to forward two types of textures.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then we'll want to go through all the textures, where we'll have a temporary string called num, and another temporary string called type, which will store the type of the current texture.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: The problem is that our textures don't store their type yet.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: I mean, they do, it's just that they store a different kind of type.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: In any case, we'll want to modify our texture class by changing the type variable to a constant character array, and so also the type of the input in the constructor.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then in the texture.cpp file, we'll want to make all the text type equal jail texture 2d, since 99% of the time, that's what we'll be using.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now let's go back to our mesh.cpp file and create some checks.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: We'll check if the type is diffuse, and if it is, make the num equal to a string of numdefuse, and then increment it by 1.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then we'll do the same check for specular and increment numspacular.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Now we want to take care of the uniform using our function text unit, plugging in the shader, then a c-string composed of our type plus num, and the unit of our texture.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then simply bind the texture.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So our uniforms will be named diffuse zero, diffuse one, diffuse two specular zero, etc.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: So in our fragment shader, we want to replace our text zero uniform by diffuse zero, and our text one uniform by specular zero.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then again, go back to the mesh.cpp file, and send our composition and count matrix uniforms, and also write the jail draw elements function.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: All that's left to do now is to modify our main.cpp file.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: First, we can delete all the includes, and only include our mesh class.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then we'll have to modify the vertices array, and after that, in the main function, make an array for our textures as well.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Delete the VIO initialization, and create vectors for our vertices, indices, and textures using the arrays from before.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Then create a mesh named floor with the vectors we've just created.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Do the same for the light, except we don't have any textures on the light, so we'll just place the same textures as the placeholder.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: In the while loop, we can just delete all the drawing stuff for the light and floor, and replace them with our draw function.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: And finally, we just need to get rid of some of the deletes at the end of the file.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: If you press run, everything should now be fine.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: If you have any errors, go over the video again, or check out the search code in the description.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: As always, you should add comments to everything if I did to make sure you understand what's happening.

chunks.title: Mesh Class.mp4
chunks.text: Bye!
